edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Class RSAOaepAbs

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.RSAOaepAbs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, RSAOaepEnc, Cca1, Cca2, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, NonMalleable, SecurityLevel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BcRSAOaep, CryptoPPRSAOaep, OpenSSLRSAOaep

    public abstract class RSAOaepAbs
extends java.lang.Object
implements RSAOaepEnc
    Abstract class of RSA OAEP encryption scheme. This class has some common functionality of the encryption scheme, such as key generation.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • isKeySet

        public boolean isKeySet()
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Checks if this AsymmetricEnc object has been previously initialized with corresponding keys.

        Specified by:
        isKeySet in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        true if either the Public Key has been set or the key pair (Public Key, Private Key) has been set;

        false otherwise.

      • getPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
        Returns the PublicKey of this RSA encryption scheme. This function should not be use to check if the key has been set. To check if the key has been set use isKeySet function.
        Specified by:
        getPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        the RSAPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

      • getAlgorithmName

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
        Specified by:
        getAlgorithmName in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        the name of this Asymmetric encryption - "RSA/OAEP".

      • hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext

        public boolean hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext()
        RSA OAEP has a limit of the byte array length to generate a plaintext from.
        Specified by:
        hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        true.

      • generatePlaintext

        public Plaintext generatePlaintext(byte[] text)
        Generates a Plaintext suitable to RSA/Oaep encryption scheme from the given message.
        Specified by:
        generatePlaintext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        text - byte array to convert to a Plaintext object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given message's length is greater than the maximum.

      • generateBytesFromPlaintext

        public byte[] generateBytesFromPlaintext(Plaintext plaintext)
        Generates a byte array from the given plaintext. This function should be used when the user does not know the specific type of the Asymmetric encryption he has, and therefore he is working on byte array.
        Specified by:
        generateBytesFromPlaintext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - to generates byte array from. MUST be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        Returns:
        the byte array generated from the given plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.

      • generateKey

        public java.security.KeyPair generateKey()
        This function is not supported.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        KeyPair holding the public and private keys

      • generateKey

        public java.security.KeyPair generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                  throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
        Generate an RSA key pair using the given parameters.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        keyParams - RSAKeyGenParameterSpec
        Returns:
        KeyPair contains keys for this RSAOaep object
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if keyParams is not instance of RSAKeyGenParameterSpec

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plainText,
                           java.math.BigInteger r)
        Encrypts the given plaintext using this asymmetric encryption scheme and using the given random value.

        All our implementations of RSA OAEP are done throw other libraries that do not provide a way to give the random value used to encrypt. For that reason, we throw an exception.

        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plainText - message to encrypt
        r - The random value to use in the encryption.
        Returns:
        Ciphertext the encrypted plaintext
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException.

      • generateCiphertext

        @Deprecated
public AsymmetricCiphertext generateCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        (non-Javadoc)
        Specified by:
        generateCiphertext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.generateCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

      • reconstructCiphertext

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructCiphertext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext

      • reconstructPrivateKey

        public java.security.PrivateKey reconstructPrivateKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PrivateKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PrivateKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPrivateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PrivateKey with the data obtained as argument

      • reconstructPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey reconstructPublicKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PublicKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PublicKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PublicKey with the data obtained as argument
